meanings.definition: To make something seem larger, more important, or more extreme than it really is.
meanings.sent1: She always overexaggerates her achievements to impress others.
meanings.sent2: He tends to overexaggerate the size of the fish he caught.
meanings.sent3: The way he overexaggerates his fear of spiders is quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement overexaggerates the reality of the situation.
meanings.sent5: The movie's special effects overexaggerate the power of the explosions.

meanings.sent1: He often overexaggerates his abilities to seem more skilled.
meanings.sent2: She tends to overexaggerate the difficulties she faces.
meanings.sent3: His tendency to overexaggerate his stories can be entertaining.
meanings.sent4: The news report overexaggerated the impact of the storm.
meanings.sent5: The artist's use of color overexaggerates the beauty of the landscape.
